messages.title: Lib Dems call for tax cuts to help people through the recession
messages.content: The Liberal Democrats have called for a big permanent tax cut for all income tax payers. Currently, people on lower and middle incomes pay a larger part of their earnings in tax than wealthy people. Under the Liberal Democrat plans, no one would pay any tax on the first £10,000 they earn.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Proposing big permanent tax cuts for all, with no tax on the first £10,000 earned, to be funded by taxing bank profits, closing tax loopholes, and scrapping special allowances for the wealthiest.

issues.economy: Proposing big permanent tax cuts for all to help through the recession.

leaflet.personalStatement: Overall, the poorest people pay the highest proportion of income in tax. If you're struggling and trying to get on, the way the benefits system works means that as much as 90p of every pound you earn disappears in tax and lost benefits. 'Working a 40-hour week on minimum wage, you'd just be £23 better off is no incentive, no wonder people feel trapped. We need to reform the tax system to make work pay.'

images.caption: Photo of Nick Clegg and Steve Churchman
